verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَا بُنَيَّ اتَّخِذِ الْغَنَمَ وَ لَا تَتَّخِذِ الْإِبِلَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Al Washa, 
(It has been narrated) from Is’haq son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> who said, ‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘O my<sup>asws</sup> son! Take the sheep and do not take the camel’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ أَبَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) نِعْمَ الْمَالُ الشَّاةُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Amro Bin Aban, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The best of the wealth is the sheep’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عُبَيْسِ بْنِ هِشَامٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) نَظِّفُوا مَرَابِضَهَا وَ امْسَحُوا رُغَامَهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Ubeys Bin Hisham, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Clean their pens and wipe their dust (from their fur)’.

verses.text: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا اتَّخَذَ أَهْلُ بَيْتٍ شَاةً أَتَاهُمُ اللَّهُ بِرِزْقِهَا وَ زَادَ فِي أَرْزَاقِهِمْ وَ ارْتَحَلَ الْفَقْرُ عَنْهُمْ مَرْحَلَةً فَإِنِ اتَّخَذَ شَاتَيْنِ أَتَاهُمُ اللَّهُ بِأَرْزَاقِهِمَا وَ زَادَ فِي أَرْزَاقِهِمْ وَ ارْتَحَلَ الْفَقْرُ عَنْهُمْ مَرْحَلَتَيْنِ فَإِنِ اتَّخَذُوا ثَلَاثَةً أَتَاهُمُ اللَّهُ بِأَرْزَاقِهِمْ وَ ارْتَحَلَ الْفَقْرُ عَنْهُمْ رَأْساً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And by this chain, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When the family takes a sheep, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Grant them its sustenance and increases in their sustenance, and the poverty departs from them with a departing. So if they were to take two sheep, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Grant them sustenance for both of them and increase in their sustenance, and the poverty would depart from them with departing twice. So if they were to take three, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Grant the their sustenance, and the poverty would depart from them at the onset’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَجْلَانَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَا مِنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ يَكُونُ عِنْدَهُمْ شَاةٌ لَبُونٌ إِلَّا قُدِّسُوا فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ مَرَّتَيْنِ قُلْتُ وَ كَيْفَ يُقَالُ لَهُمْ قَالَ يُقَالُ لَهُمْ بُورِكْتُمْ بُورِكْتُمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, from Muhammad Bin Ajlan who said, 
‘I heard Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘There is none from a family which happens to have a sheep with them for milking except it is sanctified twice every day’. I said, ‘And how is it said to them?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is said to them: ‘You are Blessed! You are Blessed!’

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَارِدٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَا مِنْ مُؤْمِنٍ يَكُونُ فِي مَنْزِلِهِ عَنْزٌ حَلُوبٌ إِلَّا قُدِّسَ أَهْلُ ذَلِكَ الْمَنْزِلِ وَ بُورِكَ عَلَيْهِمْ فَإِنْ كَانَتَا اثْنَتَيْنِ قُدِّسُوا وَ بُورِكَ عَلَيْهِمْ فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ مَرَّتَيْنِ قَالَ فَقَالَ بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا وَ كَيْفَ يُقَدَّسُونَ قَالَ يَقِفُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَلَكٌ فِي كُلِّ صَبَاحٍ فَيَقُولُ لَهُمْ قُدِّسْتُمْ وَ بُورِكَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَ طِبْتُمْ وَ طَابَ إِدَامُكُمْ قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ وَ مَا مَعْنَى قُدِّسْتُمْ قَالَ طُهِّرْتُمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ibn Mahboub, from Muhammad Bin Marad who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘There is none from a Believer what happens to have a dairy goat in his home, except the inhabitants of that home are sanctified and Blessings are upon them. So if there were to be two, so they are sanctified and Blessings are upon them twice every day’. So one of our companions said, ‘And how are they sanctified?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘An Angels pauses over them during every morning, so he is saying to them: ‘You are sanctified, and Blessings are upon you, and you are (made to be) good, and your sauce is (made to be) good’. I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘And what is the meaning of ‘You are sanctified’?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You are purified (from sins)’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لِعَمَّتِهِ مَا يَمْنَعُكِ أَنْ تَتَّخِذِي فِي بَيْتِكِ بَرَكَةً قَالَتْ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ وَ مَا الْبَرَكَةُ قَالَ شَاةٌ تُحْلَبُ فَإِنَّهُ مَنْ كَانَ فِي دَارِهِ شَاةٌ تُحْلَبُ أَوْ نَعْجَةٌ أَوْ بَقَرَةٌ تُحْلَبُ فَبَرَكَاتٌ كُلُّهُنَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, form Ibn Abu Najran, from Abu Jameela, from Jabir, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said to his<sup>saww</sup> paternal aunt: ‘What prevents you from taking Blessings to be in your house?’ She said, ‘O Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! And what is the Blessing?’ He<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘A sheep you can milk, for it is such that the one who has a sheep in his house to milk, or an ewe, or a cow to milk, so these are Blessings, all of them’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْجَارُودِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ دَخَلَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) عَلَى أُمِّ سَلَمَةَ فَقَالَ لَهَا مَا لِي لَا أَرَى فِي بَيْتِكِ الْبَرَكَةَ قَالَتْ بَلَى وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ إِنَّ الْبَرَكَةَ لَفِي بَيْتِي فَقَالَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْزَلَ ثَلَاثَ بَرَكَاتٍ الْمَاءَ وَ النَّارَ وَ الشَّاةَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, form Hammad, from Hareyz, from Abu Al Jaroud, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> went over to Umm Salma<sup>as</sup>, so he<sup>saww</sup> said to her<sup>as</sup>: ‘I<sup>saww</sup> do not see the blessing in your<sup>as</sup> room’. She<sup>as</sup> said: ‘Yes, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> that the Blessing is in my<sup>as</sup> room’. So he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Sent down three Blessings – the water, and the fire, and the sheep’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ رَفَعَهُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا مِنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ تَرُوحُ عَلَيْهِمْ ثَلَاثُونَ شَاةً إِلَّا لَمْ تَزَلِ الْمَلَائِكَةُ تَحْرُسُهُمْ حَتَّى يُصْبِحُوا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from his father, from Suleyman Al Ja’fary, 
(It has been narrated) raising it to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is none from a family to whom thirty sheep unwind, except that the Angels do not cease to enclose them until the morning’.
